title: Haunting images of America's painful past
description: Rich Frishman has travelled the United States, documenting the vestiges of racial oppression that are all around us.

title: 'Their goal is to destroy everyone': Uighur camp detainees allege systematic rape
description: In new testimony, former detainees of China's detention camps describe systematic rape and torture.

title: Fitness video accidentally features Myanmar coup
description: Dancing to music, this aerobics instructor caught a moment of Myanmar's history on camera.

title: Story of Captain Tom - the hero that gave us hope
description: The Army veteran who raised millions for NHS charities during the coronavirus pandemic dies at 100.

title: Russia's Sputnik V vaccine has 92% efficacy in trial
description: Trials with 20,000 volunteers show the vaccine gives a high level of protection against Covid-19.

title: Covid-19: People in South African variant test areas urged to 'think twice'
description: Those in areas where the South African variant was found should further limit time outside, a minister says.

title: Covid-19 vaccine: The story of how the EU felt pressure over the jab rollout
description: The BBC's Ros Atkins explains the events leading up to the EU Commission row over vaccines and the NI border.

title: Myanmar coup: What is happening and why?
description: Myanmar hit headlines around the world on Monday when its military seized control.

title: Myanmar coup: Calls for Aung San Suu Kyi release
description: Aung San Suu Kyi and other elected leaders were detained on Monday as the army seized power.

title: Australia pull out of South Africa Test tour because of coronavirus concerns
description: Cricket Australia says it has "no choice" but to withdraw from the three-Test tour of South Africa because of coronavirus concerns.

title: UK snow: Hundreds of schools shut and travel disrupted
description: People are urged to avoid travelling as parts of northern England are blanketed with overnight snow.

title: EU condemns Northern Ireland Brexit port staff 'threats'
description: All NI parties also criticise threats against staff checking on animal and food products at Larne and Belfast.

title: UK variant has mutated again, scientists say
description: The Kent variant now dominant in the UK appears to be undergoing some 'worrying' new changes.

title: Tesla recalls US vehicles over failing touchscreens
description: It follows demands from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Covid: Over 40% of deaths in mid-January linked to virus
description: It is highest since pandemic began - but there are signs the peak may have passed.

title: Alcohol deaths hit record high during Covid pandemic
description: The figures for England and Wales cover the first nine months of 2020.

title: Who does it better? How lockdown football differs across Europe
description: Watching football has changed significantly over the past year, with the major leagues all taking different approaches to keeping fans engaged.

title: Club World Cup: Watch every game from Qatar live on the BBC
description: Every game from the delayed 2020 Club World Cup will be shown live on the BBC - here is what you need to know.

title: Brexit: Millions of bees could be 'destroyed' over import rules
description: Beekeeper Patrick Murfet says the "monumentally stupid situation" could cost him nearly £100,000.

title: Covid in Scotland: FM to announce outcome of lockdown review
description: Nicola Sturgeon is expected to give details on the opening of schools to "some" children.

title: Prosperity comes at 'devastating' cost to nature
description: Landmark review calls for fundamental change in our approach to economics to stem nature loss.

title: Super Bowl 55: Tom Brady's top 10 plays for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers
description: Watch Tom Brady's top 10 plays for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers ahead of his tenth Super Bowl where he will take on the Kansas City Chiefs.

title: Fans ejected after argument with LeBron James
description: Several fans are ejected from the Los Angeles Lakers' 107-99 win over the Atlanta Hawks following an argument with LeBron James.

title: It's oh-so-quiet? The tale of a cautious transfer deadline day
description: Just three permanent deals are completed by Premier League clubs on a quiet deadline day as spending in the whole transfer window is at its lowest level since 2012.

title: Jason Collins: 'No-one else is raising their hand, I’m going to raise mine'
description: Former NBA player Jason Collins tells BBC Sport about coming out while still playing.

title: Into the wild: Could lynx be reintroduced to Scotland?
description: Three conservation charities are exploring public attitudes to bringing back the predator in the future.

title: Highlands photographer's humorous finds in snow and ice
description: Lisa Wood has spent hours in the cold taking close up photographs of icy formations around her home.

title: Who was the Sutton Hoo archaeologist featured in The Dig?
description: The self-taught excavator Basil Brown unearthed some of the greatest treasures ever found in the UK.

title: Brexit: UK fashion industry warns it faces threat to survival
description: More than 400 industry figures tell Boris Johnson post-Brexit trade rules risk destroying the sector.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: We're getting self-harming 10-year-olds in A&E
description: More children are self-harming or taking overdoses, and at younger ages, says doctor John Wright.

title: Reece Parkinson: A shock diagnosis won't stop me running
description: BBC Radio 1Xtra's Reece Parkinson tries to compete in one of the UK’s toughest ultra-marathons.

title: Pandemic fashion: 'We went from selling sequins to sweatpants'
description: How two go-to occasion wear brands were able to capture the lockdown retail market in 2020.

title: Nigeria inheritance: 'My brothers took everything when my father died'
description: Women in parts of Nigeria are being left out of their parents' inheritance, despite a law banning discrimination.

title: The tough little bottles crucial to fighting Covid
description: Vials made of extremely tough glass are being made by the million to hold Covid vaccines.

title: Wealthy home workers retreat to their sheds
description: Those who want to put some space between the home and the office are taking the garden path.

title: Is Russia targeting CIA spies with secret weapons?
description: Ex-CIA officer Marc Polymeropoulos believes he was targeted while on a visit to Moscow.

title: We joined Avon and Somerset Police’s special team dealing with lockdown enforcement
description: The BBC's June Kelly went out with the police to see how they've been enforcing lockdown rules.
